 Database questions)

Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:

>Yes, being able to switch the set of tests quickly without recompiling
>anything was one of the design goals of TestNG. Groups make this very easy.
>

Thank you all for your suggestions, and I apologize for not writing 
back. In the end I decided that my whole approach needed revamping.

Stop me when it hurts too much: We were using one database...
for unit testing...
for integration...
for product demonstration...
AND FOR PRODUCTION.

We ended up revamping the database structure so there were six 
databases. (The four above plus a heavily populated testing DB and a 
staging DB.)

For now all the unit tests use the _test db and hardcoding is no longer 
painful. Eventually we'll need to test against out heavily populated 
database, but those tests will probably be specific to the database and 
can force the db switch themselves.

-dB
subject: Re: [junit] Boxes Full of Mud (Untested Monolith, Eclipse, SWT, and Database questions)
